title.narrative: MRD-concultancy: Formulation of DIPD and DIHR

description.narrative:
The MFA has commenced a harmonisation of the modalities of support to a handful of organisations supporting promotion of human rights and democracy. The group includes the Danish Institute of Human Rights, the Danish Institute for Democracy and Parties, DIGNITY- the Danish Institute against Torture and IWGIA (International Working Group for Indigenous Affairs). The MFA has decided to align the modality with Danida’s Guidelines for Programmes and Projects based on a Development Engagement Document (DED). The Council for Development Policy approved DEDs for DIGNITY and IWGIA on November 26 2020. Submission of DEDs to the Council for DIHR and DIPD are anticipated to take place in May 2021.
The objective of this assignment is to support MUS with strategic advice, sparring and quality assurance in terms of formulating and designing the appropriation documentation for DIHR and DIPD required by the Danida Aid Management Guidelines.
To provide assistance reg. the formulation of DIPD and DIHR.
